body:
Triage; still valid. I guess this should be an error, since `@` in a `static` should be illegal.

It appears to be something do to with concrete function types, e.g. the following doesn't ICE:

``` rust
enum Foo<F> {
    Call(F)
}

static f: Foo<@fn()> = Call(main);

fn main() { }
```

Although the following does:

``` rust
enum Foo<T> {
    Call(@fn() -> T)
}

static f: Foo<()> = Call(main);

fn main() { }
```

Backtrace for the original code:

Nominating (not sure how closure reform affects this issue).
works for borrowed fn.  `@fn` is dead.  closing
actually we need to revisit whether it should work or not with proc.  Low priority.
See also discussion on moving from statics in #10577
